channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: RFK Jr. Walks a Tightrope on Trump Deal for Obesity Drugs
item.description: The weight loss medicines are proving to be a test case for Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the health secretary, in straddling divisions between his supporter...

item.title: Trump Turns to Affordability Message Amid Economic Frustration
item.description: The Trump administration is facing backlash from American consumers as higher costs from tariffs blunt wage gains.

item.title: Billionaires are swapping art and cars for sports teams as their top ‘trophy’ investment, JPMorgan says
item.description: Three years ago, only 6% of billionaires had controlling stakes in sports teams. Now, that share has jumped to 20%.

item.title: Hooters CEO says private equity turned it into a ‘boys club hangout’—Now he’s plotting a family-friendly makeover
item.description: “It's a beach-theme restaurant,” Neil Kiefer said.

item.title: Why Genpact has an Agentic AI Officer and why she dislikes the term ‘human in the loop’
item.description: Jinsook Han says that AI agents, even more so than generative AI, have the power to truly make a difference for the company and its customers.

item.title: Georgia Prosecutor Steps In to Oversee Trump Election Case
item.description: The official, Pete Skandalakis, had been tasked by law with finding a new prosecutor for the election interference case after Fani T. Willis was remov...

item.title: A Bloody Month in the West Bank Olive Harvest Leads to the Death of a Boy
item.description: Palestinians see the violence, and its tolerance by right-wing Israeli officialdom, as part of a broader campaign to harass them and make life so unbe...

item.title: Getting $190 apiece to 42 million Americans has state officials in a post-shutdown SNAP scramble
item.description: About one in eight Americans, in lower-income households, is supposed to get monthly SNAP benefits by law.

item.title: ‘Very problematic’ disclosure of ‘confidential competitive’ data between Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac roils housing world
item.description: A confidant of Bill Pulte, Trump's top housing regulator, provided confidential mortgage pricing data, according to emails reviewed by the AP.

item.title: Modi’s Coalition Leads Indian State Election Scrutinized Over Voter Rolls
item.description: Early results suggested a sweep for the ruling coalition in a state where the opposition claimed foul play over an exercise that deleted millions of v...

item.title: Zelensky’s Image Is Stained as Corruption Inquiry Shakes His Inner Circle
item.description: The revelations are a remarkable reversal for the Ukrainian president, who once presented himself as a leader who would clean up the country’s politic...

item.title: Russia Pummels Kyiv as It Torments Ukrainian Civilians
item.description: A strike that killed six was the latest in a series of aerial assaults, many of which have targeted the power grid in an effort to deprive Ukrainians ...

item.title: Stock Market Rally Is Dented as Signs of Worry Emerge
item.description: A recent dip in trading shows how investors are balancing a “fear of missing out at the same time as real fear.”

item.title: A Bloody Month in the West Bank Olive Harvest Leads to the Death of a Boy
item.description: Palestinians see the violence, and its tolerance by right-wing Israeli officialdom, as part of a broader campaign to harass them and make life so unbe...

item.title: Indigenous People Take the Stage at COP30 Climate Talks in Belém, Brazil
item.description: This summit is unlike any of its predecessors in at least one significant way: The Indigenous presence is palpable and strong.
